In what kind of world is softball removed from the Olympics while such "sports" such as rhythmic gymnastics and synchronized swimming retained? I just don't understand. When can we expect an events called "individual and synchronized dance" to be introduced while archery is removed to make room?

post_info.post_title: What kind of a world is this?

In what kind of world is softball removed from the Olympics while such "sports" such as rhythmic gymnastics and synchronized swimming retained? I just don't understand. When can we expect an events called "individual and synchronized dance" to be introduced while archery is removed to make room?

 The same kind of world that puts two people on a square platform called a ring and asks them to try to beat each other senseless (then hug afterward) and calls it a sport (worthy of the Olympics, no less).
 
 Personally, I'm crossing my fingers for competitive skee-ball.

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  What kind of a world is this?
